items.title: add_dic doesn't seem to work
items.body:
I have a script loading a local dictionary

```python
spellchecker = hunspell.HunSpell(
    os.path.join(dictionary_path, 'it_IT.dic'),
    os.path.join(dictionary_path, 'it_IT.aff'),
)
```

I then try to add a simple wordlist as a dictionary, e.g. a file just containing `foobar` and a newline.

```hunspell -p additional_words.dic -l
spellchecker.add_dic(
    os.path.join(dictionary_path, 'additional_words.dic'))
```

I double checked and `add_dic` returns 0, which means the dictionary was added. But then I try to check the word in that wordlist and spellchecking fails

```
print(spellchecker.spell('foobar')) // False
```

If I test the wordlist via hunspell CLI (i.e. `hunspell -p additional_words.dic -l somefile.txt`), it works correctly, ignoring `foobar`. What am I missing?

```

error: command 'gcc' failed with exit status 1
```
Installation is failing due the the above error. Please provide suggestions.

items.title: Get list of words
items.body: I want to get the list (or generator) of all words in the dictionary to perform some statistical data extraction. To be more specific, I want to calculate for all characters from the alphabet maximum count of consecutive characters in dictionary word.

items.title: Install on Amazon Linux gives g++ error
items.body:
I'm not sure this is specific to hunspell, but I am trying to move a system from Mac to amzn1 and am trying to build some source. I've done:

```
wget https://github.com/blatinier/pyhunspell/archive/master.zip
unzip master.zip 
cd pyhunspell-master/
sudo python setup.py install
```

and I get

```
creating build
creating build/temp.linux-x86_64-3.6
gcc -pthread -Wno-unused-result -Wsign-compare -DDYNAMIC_ANNOTATIONS_ENABLED=1 -DNDEBUG -O2 -g -pipe -Wall -Wp,-D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -fexceptions -fstack-protector --param=ssp-buffer-size=4 -m64 -mtune=generic -D_GNU_SOURCE -fPIC -fwrapv -fPIC -D_LINUX -I/usr/include/hunspell -I/usr/include/python3.6m -c hunspell.cpp -o build/temp.linux-x86_64-3.6/hunspell.o -Wall
creating build/lib.linux-x86_64-3.6
g++ -pthread -shared build/temp.linux-x86_64-3.6/hunspell.o -L/usr/lib64 -lhunspell -lpython3.6m -o build/lib.linux-x86_64-3.6/hunspell.cpython-36m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so
/usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lhunspell
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
error: command 'g++' failed with exit status 1
```

I've already run `sudo yum install gcc gcc-c++ python-setuptools python-devel ` and everything was installed.

Any ideas?

```x86_64-linux-gnu-gcc -pthread -DNDEBUG -g -fwrapv -O2 -Wall -Wstrict-prototypes -fno-strict-aliasing -Wdate-time -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2 -g -fstack-protector-strong -Wformat -Werror=format-security -fPIC -D_LINUX -I/usr/include/hunspell -I/usr/include/python2.7 -c hunspell.cpp -o build/temp.linux-x86_64-2.7/hunspell.o -Wall
    cc1plus: warning: command line option ‘-Wstrict-prototypes’ is valid for C/ObjC but not for C++
    hunspell.cpp:20:24: fatal error: hunspell.hxx: No existe el archivo o el directorio
    compilation terminated.

    ----------------------------------------
Command "/usr/bin/python -u -c "import setuptools, tokenize;__file__='/tmp/pip-build-OVj2pw/hunspell/setup.py';f=getattr(tokenize, 'open', open)(__file__);code=f.read().replace('\r\n', '\n');f.close();exec(compile(code, __file__, 'exec'))" install --record /tmp/pip-TQ8kIa-record/install-record.txt --single-version-externally-managed --compile" failed with error code 1 in /tmp/pip-build-OVj2pw/hunspell/
```

Any help with this? thanks!

items.title: comparison to other hunspell python packages?
items.body:
Thank you for making your fork available! Hope my adding this issue is okay...

I'm hoping to better understand where it fits in, in a broader sense, and had the following question come up for me: What's the difference between this code and other hunspell for python packages?

I ask because I'd googled for a python package to use hunspell and found [this package](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/hunspell) and also [CyHunspell](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/CyHunspell) listed on [PyPI](https://pypi.python.org/pypi). Seems there's others too.

Not sure if you're interested in addressing this but I can imagine this being helpful for others too if explained like in your README.md file. The CyHunspell project seems in a similar situation.

Ultimately, I'm looking for a more efficient way of using `hunspell` from Python than using `subprocess.Popen`. I'm not sure which package to use and not sure how to compare them either. Hoping someone like yourself who has authored such a package could help with that.

Thanks again!

items.title: Memory issue
items.body:
With hunspell 0.5.0, Python 3, Debian:
```
for i in range(1000):
    h = HunSpell('hunspell.dic', 'hunspell.aff')
```
This keeps filling the memory until the system kills the python process. Same issue if `del h` is added in the loop, or if the `h = ...` is embedded in a function.

items.title: Encoding Problem Python3
items.body:
Hey! I have a problem using hunspell with german words and I hope you can help me out.
An Example:

```python
Python 3.5.2 (default, Nov 17 2016, 17:05:23) 
[GCC 5.4.0 20160609] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import hunspell
>>> spellchecker = hunspell.HunSpell('/usr/share/hunspell/de_DE.dic',
...                                  '/usr/share/hunspell/de_DE.aff')
>>> spellchecker.spell('Wörterbuch')
True
>>> spellchecker.suggest('Wörterbuhc')
UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf-8' codec can't decode byte 0xf6 in position 1: invalid start byte

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
SystemError: <built-in method suggest of HunSpell object at 0xb717d6d0> returned a result with an error set
```

When I encode to utf-8 it works, but the result I get makes no sense:

```python
>>> spellchecker.suggest('Wörterbuhc'.encode('utf-8'))
['Westerburger']
```
This seems to be very weird, since [here](https://datascience.blog.wzb.eu/2016/07/13/autocorrecting-misspelled-words-in-python-using-hunspell/) was done the exact same thing which apparently worked.

I use it in a Ubuntu VM with all the necessary packages installed:
>Distributor ID:	Ubuntu
Description:	Ubuntu 16.04.2 LTS
Release:	16.04

items.title: Problem with pip install on Python 3 / Sierra
items.body:
`pip install hunspell` yields the following error on python 3.5.1 (macOS Sierra):

> fatal error: /Applications/Xcode-beta.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/lipo: can't figure out the architecture type of: /var/folders/x2/10f_q7xx4bb2cqz8qldp2pnc0000gn/T//ccTftJQi.out

Apparently would not happen in Python 2, see https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6839795/cant-figure-out-the-architecture-type-of-problem-when-compiling-python

items.title: Refer Multiple dictionaries - Add binding to add_dic
items.body:
Hi Blatiner,

As per the instructions and documentation, below is the code to run Hunspell in python:

import hunspell
hobj = hunspell.HunSpell('/usr/share/hunspell/en_US.dic', '/usr/share/hunspell/en_US.aff')

Here hobj - will refer to the en_US dictionary.
I have a need where I want my hunspell script to lookup multiple dictionaries and provide suggestions for the input word.
for example, if I have 3 dictionary files, then is there is way, that pyHunspell can look up all the 3 dictionaries and provide me the ordered suggestions? Could you please provide any suggestions no how can this be achieved? I do not know what changes could be made to enable such a feature.
Your insights on this would be really helpful.
Request you to please look into this and loo forward to hearing from you!

Regards,
Jaideep Patel

items.title: Setting up pyhunspell on windows 10
items.body:
Hi blatiner/others,

I see from your documentation that we need to install python-dev and hunspell-dev before running the command:
pip install hunspell 

But I am facing challenges installing the hunspell-dev on my windows environment. 
Any detailed steps or useful links to install python-dev and hunspell-dev would be highly useful.
Also, does python-dev mean python or is it something else?
Currently, I am using anaconda and pycharm.

Regards,
Jaideep

items.title: Please include copyright files in release tarballs
items.body: The release tarball on pypi does not contain any copyright file (COPYING, COPYING.LESSER, lgpl-3.0.txt, gpl-3.0.txt). Please include the copyright files in the next release.

items.title: Install failing on OSX
items.body:
I had an issue that the install was failing on OSX (10.10). Python3 and hunspell was both installed via homebrew.

`$ pip3 -v install hunspell`
(...)
```Running command /usr/local/opt/python3/bin/python3.5 -u -c "import setuptools, tokenize;__file__='/private/var/folders/8s/stvm9z955p18rrcwfp4xfr_m0000gn/T/pip-build-ke51ub9t/hunspell/setup.py';exec(compile(getattr(tokenize, 'open', open)(__file__).read().replace('\r\n', '\n'), __file__, 'exec'))" bdist_wheel -d /var/folders/8s/stvm9z955p18rrcwfp4xfr_m0000gn/T/tmp_yi35eubpip-wheel- --python-tag cp35
  /usr/local/Cellar/python3/3.5.2_3/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.5/lib/python3.5/distutils/extension.py:132: UserWarning: Unknown Extension options: 'compile_args', 'macros'
    warnings.warn(msg)
  running bdist_wheel
  running build
  running build_ext
  building 'hunspell' extension
  creating build
  creating build/temp.macosx-10.10-x86_64-3.5
  clang -Wno-unused-result -Wsign-compare -Wunreachable-code -fno-common -dynamic -DNDEBUG -g -fwrapv -O3 -Wall -Wstrict-prototypes -I/usr/include/hunspell -I/usr/local/include -I/usr/local/opt/openssl/include -I/usr/local/opt/sqlite/include -I/usr/local/Cellar/python3/3.5.2_3/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.5/include/python3.5m -c hunspell.c -o build/temp.macosx-10.10-x86_64-3.5/hunspell.o
  creating build/lib.macosx-10.10-x86_64-3.5
  clang -bundle -undefined dynamic_lookup build/temp.macosx-10.10-x86_64-3.5/hunspell.o -L/usr/local/lib -L/usr/local/opt/openssl/lib -L/usr/local/opt/sqlite/lib -lhunspell -o build/lib.macosx-10.10-x86_64-3.5/hunspell.cpython-35m-darwin.so
  ld: library not found for -lhunspell
  clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
  error: command 'clang' failed with exit status 1
error
  Failed building wheel for hunspell
```

I got to solve it with the following:

`ln -s /usr/local/lib/libhunspell-1.4.a /usr/local/lib/libhunspell.a `

If this issue turns out to be something general, and not related some quirk of my workstation, then it would be nice to see that hint in the documentation.

items.title: 'suggest' Returning bytestring on Python 3.4.3
items.body:
When I run say
`hobj.suggest('haukāinga')`

This is the return I get
`[b'hau k\xc4\x81inga', b'haukotinga', b'haukoringa', b'haunuinga']`

As a workaround I do
`[x.decode() for x in hobj.suggest('haukāinga')]`

which gives me the more readable
`['hau kāinga', 'haukotinga', 'haukoringa', 'haunuinga']`

Not a major problem but thought you may like to know
Thanks for the very useful program

items.title: `hunspell.error` not found
items.body:
I'm not sure how to catch exceptions when instantiating HunSpell:

``` python
import hunspell
try:
    hunspell.HunSpell('non-existent.dic', 'also not found.aff')
except ???:  # Which exception do I catch here?
    pass
```

Trying a bare `except` clause containing `sys.exc_info()`, I find a `hunspell.error`. While `hunspell.error` is defined and can be retrieved this way, I think it's missing from the module dictionary:

```
In [13]: hunspell.hunspell.error
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
AttributeError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-13-eae33c488a03> in <module>()
----> 1 hunspell.hunspell.error

AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'hunspell'
```

Perhaps the initialization procedure is missing this?

``` c
PyModule_AddObject(mod, "error", HunSpellError);
```

items.title: Online documentation
items.body:
- Add some online documentation.
- Add link in README.md

items.title: Create CHANGELOG.md
items.body: Create the CHANGELOG.md file and fill it with the changes since first version of this package.

items.title: Add documentation/examples
items.body:
Most functions are undocumented (number/type of params not specified, return values) and should be.

Some basic examples should also be added to the README.md while it's still readable.

items.title: infringed become fringe
items.body:
Hi,

I've been using pyhunspell for several days. It turns out to be quite a good stemmer. But it failed to stem the word `infringed` correctly today:

``` python
import hunspell
hobj = hunspell.HunSpell('/usr/share/hunspell/en_US.dic', '/usr/share/hunspell/en_US.aff')
print hobj.stem('infringed')
```

It returns `fringe` instead of `infringe`. 

Why does this happen? How can it be fixed? 

Thank you!

items.title: Availability of binaries for Win7
items.body:
I have made available binaries of pyhunspell for Windows 7 AMD-64 and Windows 7 32-bit at the following url:

```
https://www.dropbox.com/sh/wbu6yzj3x0hypyh/AACO6Pjb-_8VyWEbDfJ66SgPa?dl=0
```

I will leave them in my Public Dropbox for a while, a few months anyway. Or, if the maintainer wants to copy them or replace them with his own on this site, fine.

items.title: Update urls in documentation
items.body:
Please update all urls in documentation, in packages and websites.

https://pypi.python.org/pypi/hunspell still refers to https://code.google.com/p/pyhunspell/wiki/UsingPyHunspell

the debian/ubuntu package regers to https://code.google.com/p/pyhunspell/

Additional question, is debian/ubuntu already shipping code from this project? See also https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/pyhunspell/+bug/1326518

items.title: Add binding add_dic
items.body: Add a binding to add_dic function in order to be able to add a full specialized dict at once, instead of adding word by word.
